byline.original: By MICHAEL D. SHEAR and ASHLEY PARKER

abstract: Republican presidential candidate Mitt Romney has shed much of the operational and psychological baggage that weighed down, and ultimately doomed, his campaign in 2008; gone are extensive debate rehearsals, bickering consultants, corporate dress code and the urge to explain everything, which may account for why Romney's public presentation and debate appearances have been far more consistent in the 2012 campaign.
snippet: Mitt Romney has shed much of the operational and psychological baggage that weighed down his maiden campaign.
lead_paragraph: Mitt Romney has shed much of the operational and psychological baggage that weighed down his maiden campaign.

headline.main: Lectern Gone, Romney Finds More Success
headline.print_headline: Lectern Gone, Romney Finds More Success
headline.seo: For Romney, Lesson of 2008 Is Fewer Lessons
